Counters

Source: vignettes/counters.Rmd
counters.Rmd

whereami stores in counters when a whereami call was invoked in a script during a session. This information can be used in control reactivity in shiny app development and testing.

Below shows the basics of accessing and controlling counters.

library(whereami)

tf <- system.file('example.R',package = 'whereami')

readLines(tf)
#> [1] ""                                                     
#> [2] "whereami::cat_where(whereami::whereami(tag = 'tag1'))"
#> [3] ""                                                     
#> [4] "whereami::cat_where(whereami::whereami(tag = 'tag2'))"
source(tf)
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (1) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (1) ─────────────────────────────

Query Counter State


# All counters
counter_state()
#> $`/home/travis/R/Library/whereami/example.R#2`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`/home/travis/R/Library/whereami/example.R#4`
#> [1] 1

# A single counter
counter_state(tag = 'tag1')
#> [1] 1

Accessing Counters


# Counter names
counter_names()
#> [1] "/home/travis/R/Library/whereami/example.R#2"
#> [2] "/home/travis/R/Library/whereami/example.R#4"

# Counter tags
counter_tags()
#> /home/travis/R/Library/whereami/example.R#2 
#>                                      "tag1" 
#> /home/travis/R/Library/whereami/example.R#4 
#>                                      "tag2"

Retrieve Counters

counters <- counter_get()

counters
#>    tag       where                            path                when
#> 1 tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 2 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#>   count
#> 1     1
#> 2     1

Manipulating Counters

Using counter_reset and counter_state in a loop


for( i in 1:10 ){

  source(tf)

  if( counter_state(tag = 'tag1') > 5 )
    counter_reset(tag = 'tag2')
}
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (2) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (2) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (3) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (3) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (4) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (4) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (5) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (5) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (6) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (6) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (7) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (1) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (8) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (1) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (9) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (1) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (10) ────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (1) ─────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#2 (11) ────────────────────────────
#> ── Running eval(ei, envir) at example.R#4 (1) ─────────────────────────────

Plot Method

plot(counter_get())

json logs

A json log of the counter is written to file.path(tempdir(),'whereami.json') by default. The path can be set using set_whereami_log().

jsonlite::read_json(
file.path(tempdir(),'whereami.json'),
simplifyVector = TRUE)
#>     tag       where                            path                when
#> 1  tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 2  tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 3  tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 4  tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 5  tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 6  tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 7  tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 8  tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 9  tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 10 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 11 tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 12 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 13 tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 14 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 15 tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:57
#> 16 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:58
#> 17 tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:58
#> 18 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:58
#> 19 tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:58
#> 20 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:58
#> 21 tag1 example.R#2 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:58
#> 22 tag2 example.R#4 /home/travis/R/Library/whereami 2019-11-05 02:37:58
#>    count
#> 1      1
#> 2      1
#> 3      2
#> 4      2
#> 5      3
#> 6      3
#> 7      4
#> 8      4
#> 9      5
#> 10     5
#> 11     6
#> 12     6
#> 13     7
#> 14     1
#> 15     8
#> 16     1
#> 17     9
#> 18     1
#> 19    10
#> 20     1
#> 21    11
#> 22     1

Clear all counters

counter_reset()

Verify that there are no active counters.

counter_state()
#> [1] "No active counters"
